item.help: Scopes enable access to particular resources, such as user data.
item.name: Sign-in

item.help: Your OAuth 2.0 client ID that you obtained from the Google Developers Console.
item.name: clientid

item.help: Allows control over when the user is re-prompted for consent. When set to auto, the user only sees the OAuth consent dialog if they have not authorized your application. When set to force, the user is shown the OAuth consent dialog each time that they click the sign-in button.
item.name: approvalprompt

item.help: Directs the interactive share button to store user and session information in a session cookie and HTML5 session storage on the user's client for the purpose of minimizing HTTP traffic and distinguishing between multiple Google accounts a user might be signed into. We call these two means of storage the "client storage".
item.name: cookiepolicy_legend

item.help: This checkbox value enable/disable the usage of cookies or session storage for the interactive share button.
item.name: cookiepolicy

item.help: The uri includes the scheme, site-domain and possibly port to be set for your site. The value you provide determines the scope of the cookie. The more general the uri, the broader the scope of the cookie. More details --> https://developers.google.com/+/web/signin/reference#determining_a_value_for_cookie_policy
item.name: uri

item.help: Where to store data after a successful login.
item.name: data-store

item.help: Specify where to save display name in data store.
item.name: data-name

item.help: Specify where to save email in data store.
item.name: data-email

item.help: Specify where to save user google ID in data store.
item.name: data-id

item.help: Interactive share button attributes
item.name: button_legend

item.help: Your OAuth 2.0 client ID that you obtained from the Google Developers Console.
item.name: clientid

item.help: The content URL points to the page that you want to render in the preview snippet in the share post. This URL can differ from the call-to-action button's URL, for example, you might link to an overview with the content URL and to a form with the call-to-action button.
item.name: contenturl

item.help: Specify a URI path as a deep link ID for the content link in the shared post. The value must be 512 characters or fewer in length.
item.name: contentdeeplinkid

item.help: The label that renders in the stream post that prompts the reader to act. This field should be a verb that accurately describe the action that will be taken.
item.name: calltoactionlabel

item.help: The URL that the user will be taken to when the call-to-action button is clicked from a web browser. If the button is clicked on a mobile device, the Google+ app launches your app and passes the calltoactiondeeplinkid for your app to use to determine the location within your app to take the user.
item.name: calltoactionurl

item.help: Specify a URI path as a deep link ID for the call to action button. The value must be 512 characters or fewer in length.
item.name: calltoactiondeeplinkid
item.prompt: Call to Action Deep Link ID

item.help: Text that is prefilled in the comment area of the share box on behalf of the user. The user can edit or remove the prefilled text.
item.name: prefilltext

item.help: A comma-separated list of user IDs and email addresses that you want to prefill the share settings with
item.name: recipients

item.help: Directs the interactive share button to store user and session information in a session cookie and HTML5 session storage on the user's client for the purpose of minimizing HTTP traffic and distinguishing between multiple Google accounts a user might be signed into. We call these two means of storage the "client storage".
item.name: cookiepolicy_legend

item.help: This checkbox value enable/disable the usage of cookies or session storage for the interactive share button.
item.name: cookiepolicy

item.help: The uri includes the scheme, site-domain and possibly port to be set for your site. The value you provide determines the scope of the cookie. The more general the uri, the broader the scope of the cookie. More details --> https://developers.google.com/+/web/signin/reference#determining_a_value_for_cookie_policy
item.name: uri

item.help: default value is current page URL
item.name: href

item.help: Button size
item.name: size

item.help: Sets the annotation to display next to the button
item.name: annotation

item.help: If Annotation is set to "inline", this parameter sets the width in pixels to use for the button and its inline annotation.This attribute is applicable only for inline annotation.
item.name: width

item.help: Sets the horizontal alignment of the button assets within its frame.This attribute is applicable only for inline annotation.
item.name: align

item.help: Sets the preferred positions to display hover and confirmation bubbles, which are relative to the button.
item.name: expandTo

item.help: default value is current page URL . Example : http://www.google.com
item.name: href

item.help: Sets the annotation to display next to the button
item.name: annotation

item.help: The maximum width to allocate to the entire share plugin.
item.name: width

item.help: The height to assign the button. This may be 15, 20, 24 or 60.
item.name: height

item.help: Sets the horizontal alignment of the button assets within its frame.
item.name: align

item.help: Sets the preferred positions to display hover and confirmation bubbles, which are relative to the button.
item.name: expandTo

item.help: The link to the Google+ post must be in its canonical format:
item.name: href
item.prompt: The link to the Google+ post

item.help: The URL of the Google+ page or user profile that the user might choose to follow
item.name: href
item.prompt: The URL of the Google+ page or user profile

item.help: Sets the annotation to display next to the button.
item.name: annotation

item.help: The pixel height of the button to render.This height controls only the height of the button. If you use the vertical annotation, the actual height of the full widget will be larger.
item.name: height

item.help: Describes the relationship of the entity defined at the href location to the page the badge is embedded.
item.name: rel

item.help: These parameters specify the applications that are started along with the Google+ Hangout when a user clicks the button
item.name: initial_apps_legend

item.help: The project number retrieved from the Google Developers Console that corresponds to the application that this button launches.
item.name: app_id

item.help: This optional parameter specifies the type of Hangout app created when the user clicks the button. Setting this parameter changes the way that Hangout applications are loaded for the Hangout and its participants
item.name: app_type

item.help: his optional parameter specifies data to be passed to the initial instantiation of the app. Only the first participant to join the application has this value present in the response from gapi.hangout.getStartData.
item.name: start_data

item.help: The following parameters are used to initialize the Hangout button. These parameters determine the type of Hangout to create and the apps to launch when the Hangout starts.
item.name: button_settings_legend

item.help: Pre-populates the topic field for Hangouts on Air. Note that users can change the topic of the Hangout after they have joined.
item.name: topic

item.help: Specifies what type of Hangout should be started.
item.name: hangout_type

item.help: Specifies the width of the button. The default value is 136.
item.name: widget_size

item.help: These parameters specify the people invited to the Google+ Hangout when the user clicks the button
item.name: invites

item.help: Specifies the type of invites.
item.name: invites_type

item.help: Invites' identifiers with comma delimiter
item.name: ids

item.help: Badge Type
item.name: badgetype

item.help: The URL of the Google+ profile or of the Google+ page or of the Google+ community .
item.name: href

item.help: Sets the orientation of the badge.
item.name: layout

item.help: Displays the cover photo in the badge if set to true and the photo exists.This attribute isn't applicable for landscape layout.
item.name: showcoverphoto

item.help: Displays the tag line if set to true.This attribute isn't applicable for landscape layout.
item.name: showtagline

item.help: The color theme of the badge. Use dark when placing the badge on a page with a dark background.
item.name: theme

item.help: Displays a list of community owners if set to true. It's available only for badge of community type.
item.name: showowners

item.help: The pixel width of the badge to render. The following ranges are valid: Portrait layout 180-450 pixels , Landscape layout 273-450 pixels
item.name: width

item.help: The pixel height of the badge to render
item.name: height

item.help: Image Url
item.name: image

item.help: The full web property ID (e.g. UA-65432-1) for the tracker object.
item.name: accountID
